author: bergmeister
body:
Not sure if this has happened before or is due to a new test, but there were recently 2 different `AppVeyor` PR builds that got stuck and then only aborted due to the 3 hour timeout.

I first saw it in [this ](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/v6.1.0-preview.9622) PR build of PR 7013 and then also in [this ](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/v6.1.0-preview.9662)PR build of PR 7033
The log stops at different tests in those 2 runs, therefore not sure if it is a problem of a specific test or aftereffect of a certain test suite or an AppVeyor problem

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I guess there was unhandled error in build process.

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body:
It happened again (in master on a normal and on a daily build) yesterday:
- https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/v6.1.0-preview.9751
- https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell-f975h/build/v6.1.0-preview.713

cc @TravisEz13

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
The last two hangs I saw where in this code: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/tools/appveyor.psm1#L551

I'm guessing that AppVeyor is hanging after we throw the error back to appveyor.  
Finish is a really wierd place to be doing this type of stuff... building a package and testing it.  I would refactor this into a different bulid and test job if I had the time and see if it behaves better.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Maybe don't throw - write an error and `exit -1`?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
We could try it, but need to make sure it works.
I added a way to include a failing test to the travis-ci workflow to make sure this type of code works:  https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/d76cdc3c5cfab729afe3fd83ce4aeda1cf1f1267/tools/travis.ps1#L173

title: AppVeyor PR builds can hang sporadically and then timeout/abort after only 3 hours
